reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in July. The room was smaller than I expected. It was supposed to be a double room but 2 beds had in fact been put together, there is advertised a trouser press in the room but when I asked the receptionist she said it's not guaranteed and most Hotels have single beds that they put together so the room can be used for twin or double. First time I have ever known that. The breakfast was excellent and the bar staff were exceptional. The receptionist who was on when we arrived was very helpful, showed us to our room and told us where everything was. The receptionist when we left could learn a few things from her, especially her attitude. We travelled from New Zealand. We chose this Hotel as I lived nearby as a youngster and it was always a good place to go for a drink. The cleaners seem to clean where they see. We put our suitcase on top of the wardrobe and when we got it down it was filthy as was the TV stand. They had obviously been doing some sort of repairs and had painted over it and left the room in 2 different colors. The bathroom door had a glass window so there was no privacy when going to the toilet. (see photos).
reviews.title: Could do better
Great party venue
reviews.text: I organised my mum's 60th party Here and the staff were great, so organised and couldn't do enough to help. Great value, nicely decorated hall and the hog roast went down a storm. They even cleared up at the end. My mum stayed the night there in the honeymoon suite which is a gorgeous room and has a 4 poster bed. Can't recommend enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel/restaurant/bar.
reviews.title: Wished we`d had a longer stay
Great hotel and impressive wedding venue
reviews.text: A lovely welcome by Rebecca on reception. Shown to a lovely room, but for me, I didn`t like the noise from the extractor fans from the kitchen (that is just me, it wasn`t that bad really) so could have put up with it for one night, but on mentioning it to Rebecca she immediately offered us another room to view, happy to say equally nice and we moved. Room excellent, even had two TV`s, spotlessly clean and comfy spacious bed, lovely complimentary toiletries. Great garden with comfy sofa`s and benches. Breakfast was good, but need to source some nicer sausages! Have to say that is the only complaint we had and would recommend this hotel highly.

stayed here for two nights during friends' wedding and was extremely impressed by the hotel, it's location and surroundings, the food, bar, gardens and as a wedding venue. The staff were very helpful and personable, the food exceeded expectations and the Bull's Head impressed all guests. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone whether passing through this lovely part of the country or as a magnificent wedding venue.
reviews.title: Solo hotel stay

reviews.text: Very impressed - staff friendly & helpful, room delightful, clean & comfortable. Breakfast was lovely but serving finishing at 9 was the only down side for someone who likes a lie-in when on holiday. A lovely place for an overnight stay - Chiselhurst is quaint too!
reviews.title: A little bit of luxury

reviews.text: I had eaten here before (see my other review) but I always tend to stay at another hotel in the area I went for a change.
reviews.title: Really nice pub/hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say this is primarily a pub/restaurant with hotel facilities but this doesn't bother me at all as it's quite a nice change to being somewhere with suits at every table looking at their blackberry's or iphones. The locals are really friendly and you don't get too many strange looks (I was watching Man Utd on the tv so there were some to be expected!).
reviews.title: can't recommend it enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good and the service all but one member of staff was also very good (the management have actually called me to ask about this other person, I left a review about it on the website that I booked the hotel with so I was very impressed by this too).
reviews.title: One night stand

reviews.text: The rooms are really nicely decorated, the beds are huge and the bathroom very wel equipped.
reviews.title: An amazing wedding - an amazing venue

reviews.text: A hotel with a bustling local trade of diners and people having drinks only, pretty full all the time. Great food at reasonable cost served by friendly, cordial staff. A great air of friendliness and a warm open fire made the place welcoming and cosy, all day. The room was fine, great beds and modern decor and clean. Paintwork in the public areas, especially on the doors, needed washing and upgrading but that's only minor. Breakfast and excellent and was served by a friendly man who is happy in his work.
reviews.title: Lovely friendly warm old Inn, great food
Lovely hotel handy for Central London but in a "village" setting
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, room was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. The 9.00 am cut off for breakfast was a little early for us as we were there for a break, but did mean we got out earlier than usual. From this quite "village like" location it was a 20 min walk to the railway station and 30 minute train ride to central London. The pub was lovely and obviously liked by the locals as it was always busy. 45 min wait for food was unacceptable and so we only ate there once in the evening.

I'm finding it difficult to be absolutely fair because this is a delightful place but i had a few niggles. When I arrived the receptionist answered the telephone and I was left waiting to check in for about 10 minutes. The room (double) is fine for a single person a bit snug for two. Breakfast yummy.
reviews.title: An hotel of mixture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second overnight stay and we were not disappointed. The room was spacious, clean and well equipped. Lovely bathroom, with a great range of toiletries and a really good shower. Good range of tea and coffee plus biscuits (not that I got to try them!)
reviews.title: Friendly hotel, great room

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat dinner in as the restaurant isn't open on Sunday evenings and there was a quiz in the bar. Instead we had a great curry in the Bengal Lancer almost next door.
reviews.title: Wedding Venue

reviews.text: My relative held his wedding there last weekend and many of us who attended the wedding stayed at the hotel:
reviews.title: Could not find fault

reviews.text: Firstly the rooms at this hotel were fabulous. Pricey yes, but worth it for special occasions.
reviews.title: Great value and great food

reviews.text: The bridal suite had to be seen to be believed- more like a flat than the double room with sitting room and bath which it is. Huge, luxuries, but tasteful- not like a call girls room as so many seem to be.
reviews.title: Gorgeous location, great staff and brilliant hosts! Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: The food for the wedding was very good, perhaps a bit too much. The vegetarian actually better than the meat course. The waitresses treated the event as a celebration rather than just a task.
reviews.title: Perfect place to eat, drink, stay and relax
Weddings!
reviews.text: The complicated timing and coordination of the event could not have been better planned.
